1.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)
properly, to be dense, i.e. tough or severe (in various applications)
the nape or back of the neck (as declining); hence, the back generally (whether literal or figurative)
a wink, i.e. moment(used only (with or without preposition) adverbially, quickly or unexpectedly
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity

2.brief: probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

3.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)

to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

4.brief: properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a present (as offered up), especially in sacrifice or as tribute
to pull down or in pieces, break, destroy

5.brief: properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a stroke, literally or figuratively (in various applications, as follow)

6.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

7.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand

8.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire

9.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, nearness (used only as a preposition or an adverb), near; hence, generally, with, by, at, among, etc.
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to quiver (with any violent emotion, especially anger or fear)
to laugh (in pleasure or detraction); by implication, to play
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a descent, i.e. imposition, unfavorable (punishment) or favorable (food); restfulness

10.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
complete; usually (morally) pious; specifically, gentle, dear
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

11.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
properly, to address in aloud tone, i.e. (specifically) loud; figuratively, to pacify (as if by words)

12.brief: to prick up the ears, i.e. hearken
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to attend as a menial or worshipper; figuratively, to contribute to
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person

13.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to come in contact with, whether by accident or violence; figuratively, to concur
to be (causative, make) luminous (literally and metaphorically)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

14.brief: to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)
properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

15.brief: a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
(concretely) a boy (as active), from the age of infancy to adolescence; by implication, a servant; also (by interch. of sex), a girl (of similar latitude in age)
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
a mother (as the bond of the family); in a wide sense (both literally and figuratively (like father))

16.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
fall, i.e. decadence; concretely, a ruin; specifically a carcase
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

17.brief: to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

18.brief: a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
to loosen; by implication, to expose, dismiss; figuratively, absolve, begin
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
happiness; only in masculine plural construction as interjection, how happy!

19.brief: a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to chastise, literally (with blows) or figuratively (with words); hence, to instruct
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

20.brief: to gaze at; mentally to perceive, contemplate (with pleasure); specifically, to have avision of
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to press; (by implication) to be close, hurry, withdraw
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy
properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

21.brief: the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

22.brief: a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
properly, to grate, i.e. (figuratively) to anger
a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense)
heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)

23.brief: arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to depress or sink (expectation figuratively, to humiliate, intransitive or transitive)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness

24.brief: to be smooth (figuratively); by implication (as smooth stones were used for lots) to apportion or separate
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

25.brief: ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
a noose (for catching animals) (literally or figuratively); by implication, a hook (for the nose)
figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to be (causatively, make) lofty, especially inaccessible; by implication, safe, strong; used literally and figuratively

26.brief: abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

27.brief: properly, something disgusting (morally), i.e. (as noun) an abhorrence; especially idolatry or (concretely) an idol
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
